episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the repeated theft of Elizabeth Barrett Browning's spaniel by Victorian dog thieves, the Democratic Republic of Congo's plan to parade its first prime minister's gold tooth, a 1920s scam involving thousands of people with the surname Drake trying to claim Sir Francis Drake's fortune, and humorous titles of 20th-century American science fiction works.

facts.fact: The Victorian poet, Elizabeth Barrett Browning, had her spaniel stolen by London's dog banditty on three separate occasions.
The Democratic Republic of Congo is planning an official parade of its first prime minister's gold tooth.
In the 1920s, thousands of people with the surname Drake fought a legal battle to inherit Sir Francis Drake's fortune.
20th century American science fiction works include the titles "Servants of the Wank" and "Planet of the Knobheads."
